intro: Dombeya midongyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
